required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Inpatient and Outpatient Balloon Catheter Cervical Ripening
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison Between Inpatient and Outpatient Balloon Catheter Cervical Ripening: A Prospective Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A randomised controlled trial comparing cervical ripening using foley catheter as in- or outpatient setting.

detailed_description.textblock: The study evaluated the efficacy and safety of outpatient versus inpatient Foley catheter cervical ripening and patients' satisfaction. Sixty low-risk women were randomized to outpatient and inpatient management of intracervical Foley catheter digital insertion. The outpatient group was provided with verbal and written 24-hours contact information and instructions. Both groups were reassessed the next morning unless labor had begun or the catheter had dropped off.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The patients were randomised to cervical ripening with foley catheter as inpatient or outpatient setting.

secondary_outcome.description: Mean Bishop score prior to induction. Unfavourable score has minimum score of 0 and maximum score of 5.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From insertion of Foley catheter until labour established or the following morning
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Bishop score at second assessment. Unfavourable score has minimum score of 0 and maximum score of 5.

arm_group.description: Participants had intracervical ripening with foley catheter after admission into the ward.
Participants had intracervical ripening with foley catheter and allowed home.

intervention.description: Participants were assessed when labour was established or the following morning.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- singleton
- gestational age beyond 37 weeks
- cephalic presentation
- intact membranes
- Bishop score less than 6
- lives within 10km from National University Malaysia Medical Centre or able to reach within 30 minutes
- readily available transport
Exclusion Criteria:
- intrauterine death
- intrauterine fetal growth restriction
- estimated fetal weight more than 4000gram
- fetal anomalies
- abnormal pre-induction cardiotocograph
- non-vertex presentation
- unstable lie
- sepsis
- hypertension
- allergy to latex
- previous uterine scar
- history of antepartum haemorrhage
- parity of 6 and more
- placenta praevia
- suspected cephalopelvic disproportion
